TopicTitle: To speak in a fashion similar to an upper-class person of british origin

Articles.Content:
I say, I say, we must only speak in a fashion similar to an upper-class person of british origin!

What a wonderful forum game!
Good sir, I must say you are stereotyping British gentlemen!
I must say, this thread shall be quite jolly!
I do say, jolly good on you for the making of this jolly good thread my very jolly good sir! Tally ho!
Why I do say, why must we speak in this nonsensical fashion?
Because, my dear sir, we are obliged to use the Queen\'s English wherever and whenever we may, old chap!
Well, I quite fancy this fashion, even if it is nonsensical, if I do say so myself.
Quite! Speaking in this fashion is quite elegant, and peaceful, if I do say so myself as well!
I find that this tone is fanciful and prancey-like, allowing your mind to wander down the halls of Westminster with frivolous thoughts and equally frivolous actions.
Rather chilly outside, nothing a good cup of tea cant handle.

> 
> Rather chilly outside, nothing a good cup of tea cant handle.

Ah, yes! A good cup of tea is always good, old chap!
And redundancy is always redundant, Watson my good fellow.

JOLLY GOOD JOLLY GOOD WHAT WHAT TEA I SAY INDEED OLD CHAP GOOD FELLOW

/thread
A remarkable observation, my dear Holmes!
I say, this is a jolly good idea, is it not?
Quite so, my good man. There is not a thing in the world more fanciful than speaking as such.
Sir, why our guests speak so upper-class british?
Because, my good man, the Queen\'s English is obviously superior. Please, enjoy some scones. Reginald!
Sir, is hunting on wild animals with some cup of tea and a rifle a normal upper-class british tradition?
Yes, quite. We gentlemen do enjoy our fox outings from time to time, if only to be able to drink tea from horseback.
Hold up old chap! Fox outings were banned by the peasantry (read: Government) some time ago!
\'tis usually grouse that are hunted, my dicky old chum. Unlike foxes, they are not so unsportsmanlike as to run away.
Then let us tally-ho to the foreign parts for a spot of tea and killing the French, eh old chaps?

Yer a\' gonna drown in \'dem buckets o\' tea, \'ya dumb brits.

Us people from Tennersee are gonna drink this \'ere beers \'till we die!

> 
> Then let us tally-ho to the foreign parts for a spot of tea and killing the French, eh old chaps?

A spiffing idea! Absolutely champion!
